**Hunter Tylo** (born **Deborah Jo Hunter** , July 3, 1962) is an American
actress, author and former model. She is best known for her role as [Taylor
Hayes](/wiki/Taylor_Hayes_\(The_Bold_and_the_Beautiful\) "Taylor Hayes \(The
Bold and the Beautiful\)") (1990–2002, 2004, 2005–13, 2014, 2018–) on _[The
Bold and the Beautiful](/wiki/The_Bold_and_the_Beautiful "The Bold and the
Beautiful")_.

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Tylo was born **Deborah Jo Hunter** in [Fort Worth,
Texas](/wiki/Fort_Worth,_Texas "Fort Worth, Texas"), the daughter of Jo Anne
and Morris Jabez Hunter. She is of Cherokee Native American descent on her
mother's side.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_] She has an older brother Jay, who passed away
August 29, 2018, and a younger brother named Cliff. Tylo has been credited as
**Deborah Morehart** ; Morehart was the last name of her first husband.

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

In 1984, credited as Deborah Morehart, Tylo appeared in the sorority [slasher
film](/wiki/Slasher_film "Slasher film") _[The
Initiation](/wiki/The_Initiation_\(film\) "The Initiation \(film\)")_ with
future _[Melrose Place](/wiki/Melrose_Place "Melrose Place")_ actress [Daphne
Zuniga](/wiki/Daphne_Zuniga "Daphne Zuniga"). Tylo subsequently became well
known after playing regular roles in US daytime [soap operas](/wiki/Soap_opera
"Soap opera"). Her television debut was on _[All My
Children](/wiki/All_My_Children "All My Children")_ in
[1985](/wiki/1985_in_television "1985 in television"). She was fired from the
role in 1988, on the grounds of having a relationship with another cast
member, [Michael Tylo](/wiki/Michael_Tylo "Michael Tylo") (whom she married in
1987).[1]

In 1989, she was cast as Marina Toscano on _[Days of Our
Lives](/wiki/Days_of_Our_Lives "Days of Our Lives")_. The character was a
rival who caused trouble for one of the soap's most popular couples, [Steven
"Patch" Johnson](/wiki/Steve_Johnson_\(Days_of_our_Lives\) "Steve Johnson
\(Days of our Lives\)") and [Kayla Brady](/wiki/Kayla_Brady "Kayla Brady").
Tylo later said, "Everyone hated my character.[...]I hated her. They
[producers] said they were going to do something with her, but they never did.
[...] I dreaded going to work for the last few weeks I was on the show." The
character was [killed off](/wiki/Killed_off "Killed off") and Tylo left the
series in 1990.

Discouraged by her lack of success on soap operas, Tylo decided to quit
acting, and enrolled at [Fordham University](/wiki/Fordham_University "Fordham
University") in the [Bronx, New York](/wiki/Bronx,_New_York "Bronx, New
York"), intending to be a [pre-med](/wiki/Pre-med "Pre-med") student. As she
and her husband were preparing to move to [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City
"New York City"), she was offered a role of [Dr. Taylor
Hayes](/wiki/Taylor_Hayes_\(The_Bold_and_the_Beautiful\) "Taylor Hayes \(The
Bold and the Beautiful\)") on _[The Bold and the
Beautiful](/wiki/The_Bold_and_the_Beautiful "The Bold and the Beautiful")_.
She initially resisted the part but eventually relented. She began her tenure
in 1990, while still pursuing her degree at Fordham.[1]

In 2000, Tylo released her autobiography, _Making a Miracle_.[2] Tylo left
_The Bold and the Beautiful_ in 2002. She returned to the show in 2004 for a
two-episode appearance as a vision.[3] In May 2005, she returned as a series
regular and left the series again in July 2013.[3][4] In 2014 she returned to
the show for a several weeks story arc.

###
Lawsuit[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Lawsuit")]

In 1996, Tylo was cast in the primetime soap opera _[Melrose
Place](/wiki/Melrose_Place "Melrose Place")_ and opted to leave _The Bold and
the Beautiful_ to take the role. However, she was fired by _Melrose Place_
producer [Aaron Spelling](/wiki/Aaron_Spelling "Aaron Spelling") prior to
filming any episodes for the series, when she announced she was pregnant. The
character she was to play, Taylor McBride, was recast, [Lisa
Rinna](/wiki/Lisa_Rinna "Lisa Rinna") taking the role. Tylo quickly returned
to _The Bold and the Beautiful_. Tylo sued Spelling on grounds of
discrimination for being pregnant and won $4.8 million from a Los Angeles
jury. Spelling argued that Tylo's pregnancy rendered her unable to play the
character, who was supposed to be a sexy seductress. During the trial, Tylo
published pictures of herself while pregnant which showed that she retained a
slim figure. Prior to trial, during the [discovery](/wiki/Discovery_\(law\)
"Discovery \(law\)") phase of the [litigation](/wiki/Litigation "Litigation"),
Tylo's lawyers won a partial victory in an interlocutory appeal challenging a
lower court's order compelling her to answer a broad range of personal
questions. The Court of Appeal established Tylo's right to refuse to answer
questions in her deposition about marital problems and psychological
treatment, although the Court sustained the portion of the order which
compelled her to answer questions about her efforts to become pregnant, her
husband's ability or inability to impregnate her, and communications with her
agent with respect to her efforts and ability to become pregnant. The case is
widely recognized as an important one in establishing the right of privacy in
deposition and the right of actresses to continue to work while pregnant.[5]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

### Marriages and
children[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Marriages and children")]

Tylo has been married three times and has four children. She married her first
husband, Tom Morehart, in 1980. They have a son, Christopher "Chris" Morehart,
and divorced in 1984.[3]

In 1987, she married actor [Michael Tylo](/wiki/Michael_Tylo "Michael Tylo"),
with whom she had daughters Izabella Gabrielle and Katya Ariel Tylo and son
Michael Edward "Mickey" Tylo, Jr. In 1998, the couple's daughter Katya was
diagnosed with a rare cancer of the eye called
[retinoblastoma](/wiki/Retinoblastoma "Retinoblastoma"). Doctors removed the
affected right eye and began [chemotherapy](/wiki/Chemotherapy
"Chemotherapy"). Later in the year a tumor was detected in Katya's other eye;
that tumor inexplicably disappeared. Katya recovered and wears a prosthetic
right eye.[6] The couple divorced in 2005. On October 18, 2007, their son,
Michael Tylo, Jr., drowned in the family pool in [Henderson,
Nevada](/wiki/Henderson,_Nevada "Henderson, Nevada").[7] The [Clark County
Coroner](/wiki/Clark_County_Coroner "Clark County Coroner") concluded that
Michael Tylo, Jr.'s death was caused by "drowning due to seizure disorder,"
and was ruled [accidental](/wiki/Accident "Accident").[8]

In May 2008, Tylo filed a restraining order against boyfriend Corey Cofield,
claiming that he had acted violently towards her and her children.

Shortly after the death of her mother, Joanne Hunter, on November 29, 2009,
Tylo married Gersson Archila in a secret ceremony in [Las
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas "Las Vegas"), [Nevada](/wiki/Nevada "Nevada").[9] The
marriage was annulled on August 30, 2018 due to Court findings of Gersson
being of poor moral character; 3 convicted counts of spousal abuse, auto
theft, drug paraphernalia, misrepresentation by false identity, and hiding a
criminal past.

###
Religion[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Hunter_Tylo&action=edit&section=6&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Religion")]

Tylo is a [born again Christian](/wiki/Born_again_\(Christianity\) "Born again
\(Christianity\)").[6][10] She attributes her daughter Katya's recovery from
cancer to constant prayer and credits her faith for helping her deal with the
death of her son, Michael.[11][12]
